nodes.bodyText: should we hide constructors (make them protected) of JdbcConnectorFactory and use static method instead? It's not obvious why module should be wrapped in withCredentialProvider and this commit changes mechanics of JdbcConnectorFactory

Hiding constructors is quite invasive change.
You should use withCredentialProvider when connector expects user should pass user and password in config properties.
It is a typical jdbc connector behaviour. Notice that typically connector extend io.prestosql.plugin.jdbc.JdbcPlugin and from that point of view nothing changes.

add /** @deprecated  and tell what to use instead.
also the commit message ("Deprecate JdbcModuleProvider") could indicate  a hint as well

this is still the constructor (with the other one delegating here).
Will we have this deprecated staying here & being used for ever?
Once we start to use the other constructor widely, we could remove this one and then we could refactor this class and remove JdbcModuleProvider.

You're not maintaining compatibility (the FQN name of the method changed), so you can as well remove this method altogether (inline). I think we should rather pull CredentialProviderModule explicitly.

Squash with Inject CatalogName in JDBC connectors?
the Inject CatalogName in JDBC connectors commit looks so void on its own
